text: hi I'm Melissa Clark from the dining
section summer is coming and with it an
abundance of fresh seasonal fruit and
what better way to serve seasonal fruit
then with a soft moist vanilla sponge
cake what's so great about sponge cake
is how light it is it's such an airy
cake that when you put fresh summer
fruit on top of it the cake absorbs all
those good fruit juices that's why they
call it sponge cake the first thing you
always want to do before you start
baking is pre-heat your oven which I've
done to 350 and prepare your pan there's
a nifty little trick I learned to cut
out the parchment paper instead of
putting the cake pan on top of it
tracing it and then cutting out a circle
I just cut out a wedge fold it one more
time then put this so that the point is
right in the center of the cake pan and
bend it down a little bit and then this
is where you're going to cut first you
want to butter the pan then just place
the parchment paper right down in the
pan and butter the paper step one is to
mix together your dry ingredients just
combine your flour salt and baking
powder in a bowl and give it a whisk for
the exact recipe go to nytimes.com slash
dining the reason that a sponge cake is
so light and airy is because not only do
we use baking powder we also beat the
eggs until they reach what's called the
ribbon stage and what it looks like is
when you lift the beaters you should see
the eggs the mound onto themselves
almost like they're falling in a ribbon
before they sink into the rest of the
eggs in the bowl now I'm going to
carefully fold in my dry ingredients
along with some milk melted butter and
vanilla extract you want to take your
time when you're folding this together
because you don't want to deflate the
eggs now just pour it into your pan
the sponge cake will take about 30
minutes to bake you could do anything
with it you could dress it up with some
icing or maybe some chocolate fudge or
since it's summer and we've got fresh
fruit you can make a really simple fruit
shortcake
all I'm going to do is have the cake put
some fruit that's been macerated with a
little bit of sugar and what that does
is it forms a nice syrup with all those
good juices cake top on it and then
whipped cream over the whole thing and
there it is a strawberry sponge cake
with just a little bit of whipped cream
